thread.title: East Hall community mourns loss of former hoops standout Evans
thread.title_full: East Hall community mourns loss of former hoops standout Evans

author: AccessWDUN Staff
title: East Hall community mourns loss of former hoops standout Evans
text:
Jamie Evans, center, celebrates with East Hall basketball teammates. Related Articles Steve Sweat staying on to coach Dawson County girls hoops Buford announces Martin will take over boys basketball program Slater takes over Johnson boys hoops; Knights add new wrestling coach Lumpkin County lands Steele as new boys hoops coach 
GAINESVILLE — Former East Hall basketball star Jamie Evans died on Tuesday following a short illness. He was 28 years old. 
Evans helped lead the Vikings to three straight state championship game appearances in 2003-05, winning the title in '03 and '05. He was an honorable mention All-Region selection and was selected as the Vikings' top defensive player three straight years. Evans also played football and baseball at East Hall. 
"Jamie was the absolute quintessential team player. He always put us ahead of himself; he always made the little plays and the big shots that you had to have in order to win," East Hall basketball coach Joe Dix said in a statement. "He had a tremendous pride in being the East Hall Viking, and his memory will will last forever as one of the all-time great Vikings. He was a winner and every aspect." 
The Vikings were 117-9 during his four-year career. Evans was a four-year letterman in basketball and three-time letterman in football. 
He is survived by his mother, father, brother, girlfriend and sister. He was laid to rest on Saturday at St. John's Baptist Church in Gainesville. Associated Tags : High school basketball, East Hall boys basketball © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
